title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text: 2.1 Apples

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
Tree in garden
Got 3 or 4 apples in 2024
Left alone

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.2 Blackcurrant sage

Given cutting Dec 2024
Seems to be growing indoors ok

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.3 Bay

Got really big tree in garden and left alone in 2024
See how to get a successful cutting

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.4 Carrots

Sow March to July
20cm apart
In 2023 and 2024, ended up with very small and few carrots

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.5 Chillies

Planted in 2024 and still have 3 plants, seem to be doing ok

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.6 Chives

Sow March - May
Previous attempts failed, have one bought one and kept over winter - aim is to move outside

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.7 Coriander

Sow indoors anytime
When large enough to handle, thin to 20cm apart
To harvest, take a few leaves from each plant

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.8 Courgette
(RHS)[https://www.rhs.org.uk/vegetables/courgettes/grow-your-ow]n

Best started indoors, because slugs and snails
Sow the seeds individually on their side, 13mm (½in) deep, in 7.5cm (3in) pots of moist seed compost. Then place in a heated propagator, greenhouse or on a sunny windowsill enclosed in a clear polythene bag.
Need 18–21°C to germinate.
Once seedlings appear, take the pots out of the propagator or remove the bag.
Plant out in early summer after hardening off, with general purpose fertiliser such as Vitax Q4 over the compost
In containers at least 45cm wide or in ground spaced 90cm apart
Thirsty plants
Feed every 10-14 days with high potash liquid fertiliser once first fruits start to swell

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.9 Cucumber

Given a plant and grew indoors in 2024
Biggish pot
Got a few fruits 15cm long
Grew tall
Pinched out to encourage bushier

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.10 Dill

Sow March - May
Do not grow near fennel

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.11 Garlic

Have in past planted a clove or two and used the sprouts like chives

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.12 Grapes

Vine in garden
Got lots of bunches in 2024, but small and sour
Left mostly alone, a little pruning / cutting back because grew a lot and everywhere
Next time - thin grapes, so can grow bigger and hopefully sweeter?

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.13 Green beans

Sow in mid-April
Planted 6 in raised bed in 2024
Got lots of beans, grew very tall
Next time - Fewer plants and bigger sticks

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.14 Jaman

Gran gave a pot in autumn 2024
Grows well in kitchen
Makes tasty pakora
Seems quite hardy

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.15 Lavendar

Got three plants in 2024
The two by the door seem to be doing well, but the one in the pot needs more watering

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs

2.16 Lemon Mint

Found in garden in 2024
Moved to a pot and seems to be doing fine

20cm apart

Mostly left alone and seems fine

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.22 Peppers
(RHS)[https://www.rhs.org.uk/vegetables/peppers/grow-your-own]

Sow indoors in mid Feb or early March
Need 18-21 degrees to germinate
Once seedlings appear, keep at 16-18 degrees in bright light and water regularly
When they have two true leaves, move into own 7.5-9cm pot
Plant into final container in mid-May in an unheated greenhouse, at least 30cm wide
Feed once a week with high-potassium liquid fertiliser once flowering starts
Keep soil evenly moist
When reach about 30cm tall, pinch main stem(s)
Harvest mid-summer into autumn

text:
2.23 Plums

Tree in garden
Got none in 2024
Left alone

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.24 Potatoes

Threw a sprouting potato in a black bag in summer 2024 and worked well
Emptied bag out once flowered / leaves started to turn and got lots of small ones

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.25 Raspberries

Loads canes came up in 2024
Left alone and got a few handfuls of raspberries
Cut some dead canes back in winter, see what happens in 2025

text:
2.26 Rocket

Sow March to July
20cm apart

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.27 Rosemary

Big bush in garden 2024, left alone
Maybe prune back so others can grow?

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.28 Sage

Sow March-May
Kept some small plants over winter, but see how they do / plant more and move outside

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs

2.29 Spinach

Sowed some in 2024, but did not use

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text: 2.30 Spring onions

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.31 Strawberries

Got a black bag in 2023
Left alone in 2024 and got a few strawberries
See how can get more and how to propogate

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.32 Tomatoes

Sow Feb - Apr, 15-20 degrees
Transplant when large enough to handle
Plant out in 30cm pots
Feed once flowers form
Had three plants and got less than 20 tomatoes in 2024, but didn’t feed them and maybe didn’t water them enough?

title: 2  Fruits, vegatables and herbs
text:
2.33 Thyme

Sow indoors Feb - May
When large enough to handle move into individual pots
In May - July plant outside
Cut off flowering shoots for best flavour

title: 3  Indoor plants
text: 3.1 Aloe

title: 3  Indoor plants
text:
Doesn’t like lots of light
Had lots of pups and started to tip over, so replanted and split up early 2025

title: 3  Indoor plants
text:
3.2 Anthurium Andraeanum

Doesn’t like lots of light, but also doesn’t like too little
Keep an eye on water and light levels in summer
Not many flowers in 2024 - maybe due to light and water? Or needs feeding?

title: 3  Indoor plants
text:
3.3 Araceae, Dieffenbachia

Likes the light in the bathroom

title: 3  Indoor plants
text:
3.4 Asparagus Fern, Asparagu Densiflorus

Likes the light in the ensuite
Has grown quite tall

title: 3  Indoor plants
text:
3.5 Aspidistra

Not sure if happy, has lost two out of 6 leaves, but seems ok now
Keep an eye on it, maybe needs more or less light

title: 3  Indoor plants
text:
3.6 Cacti

Seem fine, don’t like lots of light though

title: 3  Indoor plants

3.7 Christmas cactus

Very happy

Given in 2024, has grown really big and strong

3.14 Lily

Don’t overwater because soil goes mouldy

title: 3  Indoor plants

Given in 2024 as almost dead, hoping to revive

title: 3  Indoor plants
text:
3.16 Moth Orchid

In ensuite for humidity
Leaves seem happy, hoping to flower again

title: 3  Indoor plants
text:
3.17 Peace lily

Likes the indirect light
Likes lots of water

title: 3  Indoor plants
text:
3.18 Spider plant

Seems to be ok
Needs repotting every couple years, to refresh

title: 3  Indoor plants
text:
3.19 Tradescantia Spathacea ‘Sitara’

Cannot kill this one
Just grows and grows
Needs light to get purple, but not too much because then browns

title: 3  Indoor plants
text:
3.20 Tradescantia Zebrina

Needs light to get purple, but not too much because then browns
Find the strong but filtered bathroom light is enough

title: 4  Outdoor plants
text:
4.20 Lobelia
(RHS)[https://www.rhs.org.uk/plants/142728/lobelia-erinus/details]

Sow seeds in late winter at 13-18 degrees
Grow in deep, fertile, reliably moist soil in full sun or partial shade.
Apply a balanced fertilizer every two weeks during spring and early summer and a nitrogen-free fertilizer every two weeks from mid-summer onwards
No pruning require

4.32 Sweet pea Lathyrus Odaratus

Collect seeds once pods have gone papery brown
Dry pods out until splits, then dry seeds out and pack away
Soak 24 hours in warm water before sowing in Feb
